item.title: ac3d's Weapon Feedback
item.dc:creator: fury
item.description:
about aiming down sights: I don’t want this feature because it would basicly only be interessting for SMG, pistol and maybe shotgun. You would also need 1 more keybinding (i need all my buttons for direct (faster) weapon switch, fast teamchat and things like dropping weapons etc.) and really it’s not worth it unless they mess up the whole weapon mechanics. Why should I aim down sights if it doesn’t do anything except looking different? The only thing I could imagine would be to replace the suit-zoom with aim-down-sights. This aim feature would not change weapon behaviour, but it would show the sights and give a mini-zoom (maybe about 65 fov). They could do that, but still I don’t really like the idea to be able to zoom in with every weapon. In my opinion it disturbs the weapon balance, because zooming should be exclusive to 357 and crossbow. That’s why I don’t like suit-zoom either. It can get abused by gaussers to hit high range shots easier. So yea… for me aiming down sights in BM would be only a really unneeded gimmick that could affect gameplay in a negative way.

item.title: ac3d's Weapon Feedback
item.dc:creator: fury
item.description:
The glock is your spawn weapon in MP. It shouldn’t be too strong. If you was able to shoot as fast as you click, the glock needed appropriate bulletspread. This isn’t counter-strike and not wolfenstein either… and seriously… Who likes clickspam? I think the HL1 style firemodes are compfortable and make sense. Either you shoot slow and precise (primary) or you shoot fast and inaccurate (secondary). In my opinion it could still get tweaked a bit (screenshake, firerate and damage) to become closer to HL1. Because in BMDM you can easily die by close spawnprotected respawners. The MP5 needs adjustments, too. In my opinion both need damage reduction, because MP5 damage is absolutely deadly. In current version of BMDM you mostly do not even need to go for headshots… MP5 recoil should get removed. The MP5 should only have some bulletspread and screenshake to make it less random. In multiplayer the MP5 should get used for spamming shots and tracking the enemies head for maximum damage. The effectivity of this should depend only on the range (because of bulletspread you hit less on high ranges), your mouseaim and your enemies ability to dodge. I am speaking about multiplayer here. For singleplayer mode I think the recoil and higher damage (like now) is fine. I think the current pistol is quite useful in BMSP (mainly against vorts, zombies, headcrabs, bullsquids and houndeyes). Still you shouldn’t use pistol when you have MP5, 357 or crossbow (unless you have high range, want to shoot very precisely and want to save ammo)…

item.title: ac3d's Weapon Feedback
item.dc:creator: TextFAMGUY1
item.description:
I always love it when people object to me asking them to use reasoning in almost entirely subjective feedback. It’s always fun to watch. Here’s why:

I don’t think the Shotgun pump is too slow. I don’t think the MP5 needs a slower reload time or a faster fire rate. I don’t think the Crossbow needs a faster reload.

Where do we go from here? I disagree with most of your balancing suggestions, but if you provide zero reasoning for any of them, there’s literally no argument to be had. I can just disagree. That’s it. Not exactly a productive or useful discussion. Sure, I can go through and point out all the ones I specifically disagree with, but the onus shouldn’t really be on me to decipher feedback like that.

The reason people don’t like the feedback is because it basically amounts to “completely change your core gameplay because reasons.” We’re all for any kind of feedback but you’re asking for a huge amount of work and a nearly completely different game. Realistically, that won’t happen. If you have more precise feedback about the weapon values and mechanics which you are able to explain, I’m all ears.

item.title: ac3d's Weapon Feedback
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
The .357 is one of the few weapons in the original HL singleplayer that didn’t already have an alternate function. The MP5 already has an alternate function.

In addition, there WAS a zoom feature in HL multiplayer for the .357, so zooming in with it in Black Mesa is not completely out of the question if you want to keep it in faithful style to the original. They simply changed it so that there’s a physically explainable reason for the zoom, i.e. Gordon focusing down on the ironsights, whereas in HL, it was complete magic.

item.title: ac3d's Weapon Feedback
item.dc:creator: ac3d
item.description:
TextFAMGUY1:

Our game is inspired by Half-Life, not by modern or more realistic shooters.

Then why add aiming down sights to the .357? Seems like a suspiciously realistic mechanic to add to the game to me, if you can add that in, I don’t see why you can’t do it for something like the MP5 as well.

TextFAMGUY1:

Also, for completely subjective judgements like “reduce pump time” for Shotgun, it helps to explain why you think those changes are necessary, rather than just state them like known fact.

I thought it was too slow, there’s a good second after the shotgun has finished kicking back from the double fire where the gun is doing nothing. I can provide more information for my suggestions at your request, but since you’ve already flat out said you’re not going to take any of them to heart, I feel very little reason to do so.

Regardless of how some of you have responded, I will continue to provide feedback on Black Mesa because I love the game and feel the need give something back to the developers that could potentially help to improve it, the next will be for the individual chapters.

item.title: ac3d's Weapon Feedback
item.dc:creator: fury
item.description:
Dude… If Valve wanted ironsights in their games they would have them already… at the time when HL2 was developed, there were already games that allowed you to go to phrone and aim down sights. The point is that Half-Life has it’s focus on simple and fast paced action… tbh I like CoD4 Promod, which has ironsights, “realistic” sprint and phrone… but these features have nothing to do with Half-Life gameplay. I can’t imagine to fire my Egon, RPG or Tau-Cannon through ironsights… it would be fun as a Mod maybe, but seriously Half-Life is great because of it’s simplicity, easy and fast gameplay.
Adrenaline Gamer was the perfect Multiplayer experience for me. It was unique and perfectly balanced. I really hope the team will continue to make their design decisions upon what Half-Life 1 really was and what it played like. In my opinion there are already enaugh unneeded changes that require to rebalance multiplayer maps and weapons. I don’t really care much about singleplayer but I don’t get the point why would we need features like that in a game that already works super nice the original way…

item.title: ac3d's Weapon Feedback
item.dc:creator: ac3d
item.description:
Sage J. Fox:

Call of Duty: Black Mesa Ops

Actually most of my suggestions were based on Battlefield, can’t you tell the difference? they’re totally different /sarcasm

Sage J. Fox:

a lot of these suggestions (beyond stat tweaks) are very… non-Half-Life.

And what exactly is Half-Life? Assuming you’re referring to the iron sights mechanic, I think Valve would have put them in the game, had they actually thought of the idea at the time, besides I’m requesting it to be optional, you don’t have to use iron sights if you don’t want to, but putting them in would make it easier for people new to series to feel accustomed to the controls, and for people like me who find it ridiculous to think a scientist killed hundreds of soldiers and aliens without once aiming down the barrel of his gun, guess I’m the odd one out.

Sage J. Fox:
  • Gluon Gun screen has power, temperature, and radiation level readings on it, no idea what you’re going for with a heat signature detector.

Yes but do they actually read the power, temperature, and radiation levels? or are they just painted on to look pretty? Any simple function, an actual function would be fine, just a bit more attention to detail, that’s all I’m asking.

Sage J. Fox:
  • Thought Black Mesa did have rolling grenades when you lob (right click) them on the floor.

No, alt fire simply lobs them in front of you, even when crouching and looking at the ground

Sage J. Fox:
  • Satchel buttons make sense to me, right click for right hand, left click for left hand. Always found having them switch once you’ve thrown one to be more confusing.

Personal preference, having the option to switch them around can’t hurt anyone

Sage J. Fox:
  • Don’t see what use the trip mine would be facing straight up. The enemy would need to walk directly over it.

That’s the point, it essentially turns itself into a claymore, for when you’re being chased and don’t have time to pick a wall to plant on, just lob it and run, BANG!

Sage J. Fox:
  • Because PEDA wouldn’t be all over Snarks as is, you want us to chuck them against the wall?

You sure PEDA’s guidelines cover foreign lifeforms? If anything they’d be for it to protect the creatures living on earth, splatter away.

item.title: ac3d's Weapon Feedback
item.dc:creator: Sage_J_Fox
item.description:
Call of Duty: Black Mesa Ops

But more seriously, a lot of these suggestions (beyond stat tweaks) are very… non-Half-Life.

On a few points:

  • I personally love all the different weapons having different crosshairs, each compliments the weapons function, from the tiny + of the perfectly accurate .357 to the big “eh somewhere in here is good” circle of the shotgun/Gluon.

  • They’re redoing the crossbow model, so they aren’t doing anything with the old model regardless. S’why it doesn’t have sprint or fancy pickup animations.

  • The Tau cannon does gib on the alt charge fire.

  • Gluon Gun screen has power, temperature, and radiation level readings on it, no idea what you’re going for with a heat signature detector. Older versions of it used the screen for the ammo count.

  • On that note, not really sure how one would help much on the RPG.

  • Thought Black Mesa did have rolling grenades when you lob (right click) them on the floor.

  • Satchel buttons make sense to me, right click for right hand, left click for left hand. Always found having them switch once you’ve thrown one to be more confusing.

  • Don’t see what use the trip mine would be facing straight up. The enemy would need to walk directly over it.

  • Because PEDA wouldn’t be all over Snarks as is, you want us to chuck them against the wall?
